The key here is that the estimator is not estimating ; it’s estimating something subtly different. It’s estimating the outcome of the following procedure.

  1. Flip the coins
  2. Randomly select a coin that follows a heads
  3. Record the outcome of that coin

But that random selection in step (2) is itself correlated with the outcome of the selected coin. For example, suppose we flip 100 coins and, out of the first 99 of them, 49 come up heads. Now we randomly select one of the 49 coins that follow those 49 heads and look at its outcome.

item.title: Rebooting my website once again
item.dc:creator: Colin Fraser
item.description: I’ve been meaning for ages to reboot this website using Quarto rather than Blogdown, and this weekend I’ve finally gotten around to it. Unfortunately porting things over from the old site isn’t 100% as straightforward as I’d hoped, so I will be doing that slowly over time.
